Class ShoppingBag

java.lang.Object
ShoppingBag
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICollection
public class ShoppingBag extends Object implements ICollection
ShoppingBag class is used to track items in a shopping bag. When an item is placed in an empty bag, it is placed at the bottom of the bag, then we place another item on top of it and so on until the bag is full. When emptying a bag, we start with the item on top then the next until the bag is empty. FILO implementation. The ShoppingBag class keeps the list of items in an array of fixed size, because shopping bags have fixed size. ShoppingBag class implements the ICollection interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShoppingBag

      public ShoppingBag​(int bagSize) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This is the only ShoppingBag constructor and require an input int bagSize with the number of the items accepted by this list. It throws an IllegalArgumentException if bagSize is less/equal to 0.
      Parameters:
      bagSize - Integer variable to set the list size.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Throws an exception if bagSize is less/equal to 0.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add​(Object newItem)
      This method adds an items to the enf of the list/index. This is a custom implementation of the add method first referenced at the ICollection interface.
      Specified by:
      add in interface ICollection
      Parameters:
      newItem - This object represents an item to be added to the list.
      Returns:
      The add method returns true if the item was added to the list successfully or false if not.

    • getNext

      public String getNext()
      This method returns the last item added to the list and removes it from it. This is a custom implementation of the getNext method first referenced at the ICollection interface.
      Specified by:
      getNext in interface ICollection
      Returns:
      It returns a String with the item name at last index of the list.
